description: After the security update KB5039212 for the Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS), end users may observe unexpected behavior when interacting with applications that rely on the RRAS service. Systems could show signs of instability, with users experiencing intermittent failures when attempting to establish remote connections. Additionally, there may be instances where unauthorized commands could be executed, leading to significant security concerns. Users might also face difficulties in network communications, as services relying on RRAS could become unavailable or erratic in performance. This symptom is especially pertinent to Windows 11 versions 23H2, 22H2, 21H2 and certain builds of Windows 10, which could be affected based on specific build numbers denoted.
